result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rena M Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Rena M
defendant.address: 6338 Prairie Cir N, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
Conditions:
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone or G.P. or any family members.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of weapons or firearms. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.

11:24 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rena M Peterson appeared by video, in custody from Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Rachel Robole. 

Defense waives reading of the complaint and updates defendant's phone number with the court. State makes a request for no contact as condition of bond. Defense objects. Victim G.P. makes statement to the court regarding no contact.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/14/2022 at 1:30 PM

Hearing scheduled for 12/06/2022 at 9:30 AM

Conditions:
No acts/threats of violence toward anyone or G.P. or any family members.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of weapons or firearms. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.
